BAS Report can be generated using Simpler reporting method or Full reporting method as detailed in ATO Website . This setup is available in AU Localisation Settings. In case of Simpler BAS Reporting method to be used, the Account setup for BAS labels are available in Simpler BAS Report Setup .

ABN validation is available for both Customer and Supplier that can be configured through the AU Localisation Settings.

AU Localisation settings page is authorized for “AU Localisation Admin“ role. Please contact the Administrator to get this role assigned to your user setup if AU localisaion settings page needs to be accessed.

Tax Category Setup

As part of AU Localisation, for every supplier the Tax Category needs to be selected from one of the values below.
  • Capital Goods Supplier
  • Domestic GST Supplier
  • Import / GST Free Supplier
Similarly, for every Customer the Tax Category needs to be selected from one of the values below.
  • GST Free Customer
  • Domestic GST Customer
  • Export Customer
For Item Master, only for the GST Exempt items like food, health and education services, some childcare services, religious services, water, sewerage and drainage services the Tax tab should have the following setup.
Item Tax Template Tax Category
GST Exempt Sales Domestic GST Customer
GST Exempt Purchase Domestic GST Supplier
GST Exempt Purchase Capital Goods Supplier

Changing the default Sales, Purchase and Item tax template may cause issues in the generation of the BAS report.

BAS Report

BAS reports are configured to generate in a Monthly frequency. This can be changed to Quarterly frequency through the AU Localisation Settings page. Please make note that the Frequency changes cannot be done, if there is an open BAS Report available in the system.

BAS Report access is authorized for the users with the following roles:
  • Accounts Manager
  • Accounts User
  • Auditor

Payment Proposal and ABA file Generation

Step 1: The Payment Proposal can be used to generate the Payment Batch for a company along with due date and the create user of the Purchase Invoice as the filter. This screen can be accessed using the link .

Step 2: The Payment Batch record will be generated automatically if the Payment Proposal (Step 1) is used. If the Payments are created manually without using the Payment Proposal functionality, the payments can be added up into the Payment Batch. The Payment Batch can be accessed using the link.

Step 3: Once all the required payments are added into the Payment Batch, ABA File can be generated from the Payment Batch. The downloaded ABA file can be used to pay the Australian suppliers by uploading the ABA file into your online Banking system.

Payment Proposal and Payment Batch screen is authorized for the users with the following roles:
  • Accounts Manager
  • Accounts User

CSV Bank Statement Import - Major Banks

Step 1: Define the appropriate bank statement format in the Bank Account doctype link.

Step 2: Upload the CSV file downloaded from your bank portal using the Bank Statement Import doctype link.
Currently supported for big 4 banks, Commonwealth Bank of Australia - Com Bank, National Australia Bank Limited - NAB, Australia and New Zealand Banking Group Limited - ANZ and Westpac Banking Corporation – Westpac.
